transcript.text: [Music]
[Music]
[Music]
hi and welcome you listening to the x22
report my name is Dave and this is
episode 1272 a and today's date is May
5th 2017 and the title of the episode is
the Fed confirms next economic crisis
massive stimulus planned let's get into
the economic collapse financial news now
it does not look good up in Canada for
home capital and we talked about home
capital where they had to get this
bailout and it looks like they received
up to 2 billion dollars but guess what
out of that two billion they've already
spent 1 billion dollars half of the
emergency lifeline they only have a
billion left and most likely they're
going to spend that in the next week or
two so when we look at what's happening
up there it looks like things are not
going to be going very very well for
home capital and it looks like they're
going to need something else to help
them get through this because they're
going through all of this cash very very
quickly and we need to understand that
this is just the tip of the iceberg
there's no way that this is just
isolated to one company just like they
all thought Oh Bear Stearns is just
isolated to Bear Stearns no other
company is going to you know be involved
in what is happening here and then all
of a sudden we hear Lehman AIG the
automobile manufacturers every bank on
the block and we can see that this is
just the beginning of the total
destruction of the economic system
because the economy right now has been
built on this illusion and the illusion
has been kept alive for since 1913 if
you really want to think about it in
those terms but lately since 2008 when
the system should have just completely
died they pumped up the entire system
kept us in this dream state all this
time to make everyone believe that the
economy is fantastic and you have to
remember the insiders understand and
they know
when the bubble has hit the top because
they control everything they understand
when they're going to bring it down and
this is why we see corporations hedge
funds investment companies they're all
getting out of the stock market they're
getting out of real estate they're
getting rid of their assets right now
because they understand those assets are
going to fall in price and they're going
to be taking their profits right now and
they want to sell this off to the retail
investor the speculator and this is
what's happening right now now to keep
this illusion alive they need to
continually come out with fantastic data
from the government and nothing's really
changed since Trump has gotten has
gotten into office here we can see that
the payroll numbers they've come out and
they're telling us that everything was
revised and everything just rebounded in
April now this looks good for the Fed
where they said hey this was just
transitory this last quarter where we
had 0.7% GDP and the next quarter
everything's going to be fantastic now
like I said they have the ability to
manipulate everything to make it look
fantastic all they have to do is revise
all they have to do is lead people out
of the job market all they have to do is
export soybeans they can do whatever
they have to do to keep the economy
looking like it is fantastic and they're
June meeting is coming up and we know
this is the in-between period of when
the GDP numbers are being released and
most likely because they have to stay on
track they will raise the interest rates
now the unemployment rate it has come
down to what four point four percent
right now this is the lowest level since
May of 2007 now we're hitting that point
in time where the unemployment rate was
almost exactly where it was before the
economy completely crashed now this
unemployment rate is completely
manipulated most of the people have
fallen off the job market those people
who haven't been on an interview for
four weeks well guess what they're just
not counted and think about it we just
had the announcement that
there are 3,500 stores that are going to
closed in the first quarter of 2017 and
they calculated it out to about eight
thousand six hundred plus stores for
this year and corporations they're not
making profits they're laying off people
so are these numbers real no they're not
it's all on how you play with the
numbers to make it look like we are at
full employment and we know that we are
not if you look at shadow stats and you
look at the calculation they used prior
to 2008 I think is going back to 1990
the unemployment rate is close to twenty
to twenty three percent and if you
calculate all those part-time jobs into
this I mean the unemployment rate is
most likely around thirty percent right
now because you have to remember those
part-time jobs they're counted as a
full-time job but when they lose them
they're not counted as a loss of a
full-time job because they have to meet
certain requirements you know the hours
and the pay and this is varies by state
by state but we can see right now that
is completely manipulated now the
central bankers their whole objective is
to continually increase the debt blow
the bubble up as big as you possibly can
and we can see already that many
individuals well they're using their
credit cards just to make ends meet
because they don't have the cash to get
the food to pay for goods and we see
right now that student loans and auto
loans they have hit an all-time high of
two point six trillion dollars I mean
this is just unbelievable and we see
right now that there was an increase of
student loans of 32 billion for the
quarter and eighty billion for the year
which brought student loan total amount
up to one point four four trillion now
on the auto loan side what are we seeing
well we saw an increase of eight billion
for the quarter and we see 73 billion
for the year this means right now that
auto loans has
gone up to about one point one two
trillion combine those two together
we're looking at two point five six
trillion dollars that is a lot of debt
and again the only way the central bank
works and works well is if it
continually spreads debt to other
countries to individuals and they need
to continually do this now it looks like
the New York Fed and the Atlanta Fed
well they're looking at new second
quarter GDP numbers and they're
estimating right now and this time they
flip-flop where the Atlanta Fed had a
very low GDP number and New York Fed had
a very high GDP number and they included
the soft data when they were calculating
that out the Atlanta Fed right now has
once again started off very strong
they're expecting four point three
percent GDP now they started off that
way but they lowered it to four point
two percent and we know that this number
is never going to be reached I mean
they're going to have to do a huge
manipulated calculation to get it to
where they want it now the New York Fed
on the other hand well they started at
two point three percent and now they're
down to one point eight percent now
think about this the first quarter is
that point seven percent do you really
think that we're going to be above three
percent actually do you really think
we're gonna be above two percent the
only way we can get above two percent is
if they manipulate it like they did
right before the elections where all of
a sudden they exported soybeans which
was a one-off thing and they brought it
up to like two point eight two point
nine percent that's the only way they're
going to get to that area but the Fed
doesn't care about that right now
because they meet in June and they will
look at the numbers that we just have
seen right now and other numbers that
are going to be coming out and they'll
say low well the Atlanta Fed and the New
York said they're telling us that GDP is
pretty good the unemployment numbers
look good and guess what we're going to
raise the rates because everyone is
going to forget about what happened in
the first quarter and the Fed said it
was transit
anyhow the reason why they need to do
this is because they are on track to
bring this economy down this is their
whole plan and by raising the rates a
little bit at a time they're waiting for
the trigger where the economy starts to
really fall apart and once it starts
falling apart it's like a snowball
coming down the hill a gain speeds gets
on more snow and as it comes down the
hill you won't be able to stop it and
this is what they want to happen and
once that starts to happen they're going
to start reversing the interest rates
just like they did prior to 2008 now we
are getting indications that the credit
event in China well things are rapidly
collapsing we're seeing red flags right
now and if we listen to Bill halter when
I had him on many different times when
we talked about the credit market he
said the credit market is eventually
going to freeze up and we know from UBS
we had the credit warning where it
dropped below zero which tells us that
something is wrong here and we're
starting to see signs that the credit
problem in China
well we are seeing different signs that
were headed down this path where things
are going to rapidly deteriorate and it
does not look good whatsoever what we're
seeing is the interbank rate in China
while they're spiking meaning banks
increasingly don't trust each other and
this is how any banking crisis begins
China's mission Bank recently issued a
ghost fraudulent wmp they raised 436
million in funds for the CDO like assets
that had no assets backing it China's
top insurance regulator chairman of the
China Insurance Regulatory Commission is
currently under investigation for severe
disciplinary violations we're also
seeing which was revealed overnight in
China that Bank wmp issuance crashed 15
percent in April and
this is a strong indicator that the
faith in these products well they're
starting to wane and what we're seeing
right now are more and more of these
warnings that are coming out that
something is happening in China and
China is the country that propped up
credit from 2008 to this point and we're
starting to see that once this falls
apart it's going to be a complete
disaster now what's very interesting
about all of this and Janet Yellen said
this a couple of months ago is that when
the Fed is introduced to a new economic
crisis they will start the stimulus up
once again and we're getting from Eric
Rosen grynn from Boston Fed and st.
Louis Fed President James Bullard that
they're saying I think it's inevitable
that we're going to be talking about the
balance sheet expanding during
recessions saying that if we have an
economic downturn once again the Fed
would again have to resort to
quantitative easing or QE when the
crisis hits now they continually are
broadcasting that this is what they're
going to do now if I'm not mistaken
they've been telling us that the economy
is strong they're raising rates right
now because the economy is doing well
why in the last couple of months are
they talking about
another economic crisis why are they
talking about lowering the interest
rates if the economic crisis hits why
are they talking about creating stimulus
for the next economic crisis because on
one hand the corporate media and what
they're telling the country is that
everything is fine we're raising the
rates the economy is doing well and in
backroom meetings they're talking about
the next economic crisis they're talking
about stimulus again
what they're doing right now is they're
confirming that we have a major problem
they already know that there's going to
be an economic crisis they already know
they can't unravel their entire balance
sheet they already know that they're
going to have to create currency that's
why they're raising the interest rates
right now they want to trigger the
crisis this way when they trigger it
they can blame it on anybody because
they're saying they're raising the
interest rates everything is fine it was
because of Trump's policies it was
because of this country it was because
of them over there this is the way the
central banks work and we can see right
now as June approaches we're going to
have to look at this very very carefully
because if they raise the rates in June
it means we are perfectly on track for
this system to come down maybe by the
end of this year or the beginning of
2018 depending on how many more times
they raise their rates because I don't
think it's going to take that many times
for something to get triggered and the
whole thing start to fall apart because
the economy has been built up on an
illusion and from everything that we've
been looking at from going back in time
from all the economic data we can see
that this economy is not what they are
saying it is just like back in 2008 when
they told us the surprise securities
they've refined triple-a the economy
strong then we come to find out after
the crash that it was all a lie what
we're going to have the same type of
thing happen once the crash happens the
truth lend will come out but of course
it's too late you can't start preparing
you can't start getting food you can't
start getting water
you can't start getting gold you can't
take your cash out of the bank you can't
do any of these things because once the
system breaks down it's too late you're
going to be scrambling like everybody
else think about go back in time to 2008
after everything started to fall apart
were you able to do anything at that
point especially those individuals that
lost their pension lost their money in
the stock market lost the homes they
owned what were you able to do nothing
and this time this time around it's
going to affect almost everyone so get
prepared
listen everyone thanks a lot for
listening be well be safe and especially
be prepared thanks a lot
[Music]
you
you
